entries.title: Australian Open: The 'inner fire' of Holger Rune, the Danish hope in world tennis
entries.description: After his meteoric rise at the end of 2022, the 19-year-old Danish player will be the one to watch in the first Grand Slam of the new season, in Melbourne, Australia, where he plays in round 1 on Tuesday against Filip Krajinovic.

entries.title: New British memoir to hit bookshelves as Boris Johnson signs book deal
entries.description: Publisher HarperCollins announced the former UK prime minister will publish a memoir 'like no other' at date yet unknown.

entries.title: UK strikes intensify with teachers and nurses set to walk out
entries.description: Teaching and nursing unions announced new large-scale strikes for early February.

entries.title: French journalists go on trial in Moroccan king blackmail case
entries.description: Journalists Eric Laurent and Catherine Graciet were arrested in 2015 in possession of envelopes containing cash, after an alleged deal to receive a payment for not bringing out a book.

entries.title: Israel: Anti-government outcry hits the streets as institutional figures speak out
entries.description: Despite division within the opposition, some 70,000 people demonstrated against Benyamin Netanyahu's coalition, the largest protest in recent years.

entries.title: UK government to veto Scottish gender law on changing gender
entries.description: Scotland's parliament passed legislation making it easier and faster for people to change their gender, but for the first time, the UK government plans to invoke its power to block Scottish legislation.

entries.title: 'Qatargate': EU Parliament President Metsola promises 'more transparency' and 'accountability'
entries.description: In a speech opening the first plenary session of the year, Roberta Metsola pledged to make new rules to limit possible foreign interference.

entries.title: Somali forces capture strategic port town Haradhere from Al-Shabaab
entries.description: The Al-Shabaab insurgents had seized the town in 2010.

entries.title: 'The concentration of power in the hands of the president of the Republic suffocates democracy'
entries.description: Political scientist Patrick Weil urges French lawmakers to act  so that constitutional powers are 'rebalanced and separated'.

entries.title: Last activists leave German village Lützerath, site of coal mine expansion
entries.description: Activists had occupied the village to protest agains the expansion of the Garzweiler open-cast coal mine.

entries.title: Australian Open: Rafael Nadal doesn't want to hear about retirement
entries.description: The 36-year-old Spaniard, who holds the Australian Open title, made a successful start on Monday following a series of losses that have raised questions about his possible retirement.

entries.title: Tony Parker's real estate project has set a whole French mountain in turmoil
entries.description: Conflict over two hotel projects near the French Alps, one of which is backed by the former basketball star, have exposed divisive tension running through the ski resorts.

entries.title: London police force under scrutiny after officer admits serial rapes
entries.description: A Metropolitan Police armed officer who used his role to put fear into his victims has admitted dozens of rape and sexual offences against 12 women.

entries.title: Fifty years ago in France, Micral N, the first commercial microcomputer in the world was born
entries.description: It was created by French engineer François Gernelle, whose name is now celebrated in American computer museums.

entries.title: Execution of British-Iranian in Iran raises tension between London and Tehran
entries.description: Accused of espionage, Alireza Akbari claimed he was forced to make a false confession.

entries.title: South African President Ramaphosa misses Davos to deal with electricity crisis
entries.description: South Africa has been enduring regular major power outages for months and public outrage is mounting.

entries.title: Gina Lollobrigida, Italian star of the Golden Age of Hollywood, has died aged 95
entries.description: She was the darling of the paparazzi and the heroine of a photo novel at the beginning of her career. She then went on to play leading roles with the greatest directors and acted alongside Humphrey Bogart, Burt Lancaster and Yul Brynner. She died at the age of 95.

entries.title: Italian film legend Gina Lollobrigida dies aged 95
entries.description: The Italian actress, a veteran of the Golden Age of Hollywood cinema, died in a Rome clinic.

entries.title: In Brazil, Lula must overcome challenges in a divided Republic
entries.description: The Brazilian president's third term is likely to prioritize stabilizing Brazil rather than major social progress and fundamental reforms.

entries.title: Brigitte Macron sows discord in the political debate
entries.description: The French president's wife spoke out to champion school uniforms and give voice to a supposed 'silent majority,' a move causing discomfort and division in the presidential camp.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: Understanding the battle of Soledar
entries.description: Why has a modest city become a focal point in the conflict? There are many reasons.

entries.title: Nepal plane crash: Air safety must be reassessed
entries.description: Since 2000, more than 300 people have died in airplane or helicopter accidents in Nepal.

entries.title: German defense minister quits amid Ukraine criticism
entries.description: Christine Lambrecht resigned after a series of gaffes cast growing doubt on her ability to lead the country in reviving its long-neglected armed forces amid the war in Ukraine.

entries.title: In Peru, rural communities demand representation and social justice
entries.description: Demonstrations are still fierce a month and a half after the impeachment of President Pedro Castillo.

entries.title: Italy catches fugitive mafia boss Matteo Messina Denaro
entries.description: Italy's most wanted mobster, who is suspected of being behind a series of 1993 bombings, had avoided capture for 30 years.

entries.title: Beijing partially acknowledges the scale of deaths linked to the latest Covid-19 wave
entries.description: The WHO welcomes China's Saturday statement but wants Beijing to release more figures.

entries.title: Death toll rises in Dnipro after Russian strike on apartment building
entries.description: At least 35 people were killed after Saturday's strike according Ukranian authorities. 75 people were wounded and 35 others are still missing.

entries.title: Davos Forum: 'The end of the month has overtaken the end of the world'
entries.description: The planet has plunged into a cycle of economic, political and social difficulties which, for the first time in years, has worried the Davos experts more than the climate crisis, writes columnist Philippe Escande.

entries.title: Svetlana Tsikhanovskaya: 'Dissociating Belarus from Ukraine is a mistake'
entries.description: The leader of the Belarusian opposition in exile spoke to 'Le Monde' on the eve of her trial in absentia in Minsk.

entries.title: Day of mourning in Nepal after deadliest plane crash in decades
entries.description: Soldiers used ropes and stretchers to retrieve bodies from the 300-meter-deep ravine late into the night, with recovery efforts set to resume on Monday. 67 of the 72 people on board were confirmed dead, after the crash on Sunday.

entries.title: Tennis: In Melbourne, the fallen king Novak Djokovic wants his crown back
entries.description: A year after being deported from the country after a political and health controversy, the Serbian tennis player is making his comeback at the Australian Open. He will try to win his tenth title.

entries.title: Chile: Pardon granted to prisoners of 2019 revolt sparks political crisis
entries.description: President Gabriel Boric pardoned 12 people convicted in connection with the violence that plagued the demonstrations. This measure was marred by 'errors' and led to the resignation of the Minister of Justice and the head of the cabinet.

entries.title: The harsh effects of isolation on Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny
entries.description: In an open letter, 600 doctors demand an end to the 'bullying' of the imprisoned opposition leader.

entries.title: NASA also funds slightly crazy projects
entries.description: On January 9, the US space agency announced that it had selected 14 future-oriented projects, ranging from laying a gas pipeline on the moon to flying a seaplane on one of Saturn's satellites.
